name: Star Lords Clash
description:
In this exciting strategy game, you must recruit the Celestial Lords, absorb their power, complete a number of quests, and defeat the Dark Lord Gargantua

You can only recruit a Lord if your power is greater than theirs

Explore vast space cities to gain abilities and more

Explore strange planet surfaces to receive quests and rewards

Explore the Lords mothership to gain special abilities, deploy military units, and find your quest location

Explore dark and mysterious dungeons to help your quest, but watch out for the vampires, zombies, ghosts and skeletons

Find the crypt and its keeper to help you gain abilities and quests

In space you can build power plants, factories, towers and military units

Enter factories to upgrade your units fire power and hull strength

Enter units to repair them when damaged

Enemy Lords also create units

Beware of Hunters which hunt you down and take your power from a distance. Only you can destroy these.

All Lords have special powers which you can absorb

Controls:

Touch the opaque direction controls to move or turn

Moving forwards or backwards takes one hour of day time, or two hours during storms (unless you have weather ability)

Touch the Lord directly in front of you to talk to them.

Touch a planet directly in front opf you to explore them.

Touch the control buttons in the center to talk or end the current day.

Touch the Star Map to display the stars and provide further options.

Touch the edges of the Star Map to scroll around the map.

Above the star map icon is now a target build icon

Touch this to enable the build feature. You can only build on an empty space directly in front of you

A HUD warning radar will display units when they approach you. (green friendly, red unfriendly)

A pulse/plasma cannon control can be pressed to damage then destroy enemies 

New sniper scope mode available in space

Both weapons use some of your power when used (pulse 50, plasma 100)

If you are using convert ability, to revert back to pulse cannon touch the convert ability button

Worm holes will teleport you instantly to a random part of the world

Random Quasars will slip back time a few hours 

Random Pulsars give extra power but bring night closer 

Star Spires and Plasma clouds absorb some of your power 

Binary stars can give you some power

At the end of the day, all Lords including yourself, receive an additional charge of power

Lord Gargantua uses this power to recruit other Lords and absorb their power

Dark Spawns and units are then released from unfriendly Lords

Friendly spawns are also released from friendly Lords

You have the following options on the Star Map:

Play the game

Start a New Game. Gives you option for normal, random start position, or Risk style game

Change the Difficulty level during the game

(Easier gives you extra power, reduces the Dark Lords ability to recharge quicker, & reduces the number of quests required)

(Harder gives the Dark Lord a greater charge each night)

Save your progress

Load a previously saved progress

Adjust the Turn time, to enable faster or slower semi real time update of the days and minutes within the game

Quit - You can quit the game and let the Dark Lord be Victorious

Guide - displays this guide

The new Risk style game, randomly pre-sets the Lords to either friend (green), foe (red) or neutral

You can then visit friendly Lords and either absorb their power and/or build units in their celestial domain

You can then either return back to Play the game as normal, or return to the star map to view other friendly Lords

Additional controls include:

Clock, which when touched will advance the time of day by 1 hour, and units will move and engage if required

If turn time is on, the game will automatically advance 

+ to magnify map

- to de-magnify map

Touch an enemy unit to find out its type

The Identity of the Star Lord is displayed, and their power which you can absorb by touching the value below the Lords name

Chose your strategy now
